org.orgName: District Court of the United States

div1.p: IN THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES, FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
In the Matter of the Application of MAC FOCK for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.

The President of the United States of America, to Honorable Ellis DeBruler, Commissioner of Immigration, Greeting: and the United States Marshal for the Western District of Wash. We command you that you have the body of Mac Fock by you imprisoned and detained, as it is said, together with the time and cause of such imprisonment and detention, by whatsoever name, and said Mac Fock shall be named or charged before Honorable Edward C. Cushman, Judge of the United States District Court for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division, at the Federal Building in Seatte, State of Washington, on the 23rd day of June, A.D. 1913, at 2 o'clock in the afternoon, of that day, to do or receive what shall then and there be considered concerning the said Mac Fock, and have you then and there this writ.

Witness, Honorable Edward E. Cushman Judge of the United States District court for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division, at the Federal Building, in Seattle, State of Washington, at Seattle on the 9th day of June, A.D. 1913.
ATTEST my hand and seal of said United States District court the day and year last above written
This within is a full, true and correct copy of an original writ this day issued WITNESS my hand and official seal this 9th day of June 1913 FRANK L. CROSBY, Clerk By Cam Laken Deputy.
